title: Principle Engineer (Materials & Chemistry) - Bellevue, WA
full_description: RCS Corporation has an immediate need for a Principle Engineer (Materials & Chemistry) for our client in the Bellevue, WA area. This is a 1-year contract opportunity with the potential of extension. Who We AreRCS Corporation is a certified Women-Owned Small Business (WOSB) specializing in the recruitment of professionals for best-of-class companies throughout the United States. Since 1994, RCS recruits top talent for direct hire, temp-to-perm and contract staffing positions and provides customized payroll services. Our Recruiting Specialties consist of all Engineering Disciplines, Project Management, Project Controls, Information Technology, Energy Efficiency and Business Professionals. AboutWe are seeking to contract a highly motivated Materials Engineer to support the engineering efforts of the Materials and Chemistry Discipline team. This role will work as part of a high functioning team of engineers focused on qualification of next generation materials for reactor projects. In this position, you will characterize and analyze the irradiation behavior of nuclear materials. You will participate in planning, developing, and implementing neutron irradiation test programs and post-irradiation characterization of samples. You will coordinate with national labs and other test facilities to perform post-irradiation examination (PIE) including FIB, SEM, TEM, profilometry, and immersion density. You will also work with other engineers to develop and execute test plans for mechanical testing of neutron-irradiated materials. You will be responsible for developing correlations to describe the resulting material performance data for design and licensing of reactor projects.ResponsibilitiesInterface with various project teams to ensure materials development and testing efforts meet programmatic objectives.Plan, execute, and oversee neutron irradiation and post-irradiation test programs designed to develop an understanding of complex nuclear material phenomena (e.g. irradiation creep, swelling, and mechanical property performance changes) in sodium cooled fast reactor core materials.Work closely with vendors and quality assurance to ensure the necessary test data are obtained for qualification and licensing of nuclear reactor core materials.Perform scientific analysis on test data and?generate technical reports to document new knowledge related to reactor design and qualificationDevelop material property correlations and advanced material performance models as input for reactor design and licensing.Offer material selection guidance for our client's reactor development programsKey Qualifications and Skills BS degree in Materials Science/Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Nuclear Engineering or relative degree and a minimum of 12 years of experience with nuclear materials.Knowledge of materials science principles, characterization methods, and testing techniques for nuclear materials is required.Experience developing and applying material performance models, particularly for irradiation creep and swelling is desired.Experience qualifying materials for service in high-performance and/or highly regulated applications is highly desirable.A thorough understanding of metallurgy including fabrication and thermomechanical processing of ferrous (e.g., ferritic-martensitic steels) alloys is preferred.Ability to work with minimum direction to solve challenging problems.The successful candidate will possess a high degree of trust and integrity,
